channel.title: Scholarship on Blake Bronson-Bartlett
channel.description: Recent content in Scholarship on Blake Bronson-Bartlett

item.title: Publications
item.description: Published Articles “Writing with Pencils in the Antebellum U.S.: Language, Instrument, Gesture.” American Literature 92.2 (June 2020). “On Digitizing the ‘Thomas Ollive Mabbott Papers’: ‘Source-Research,’ Text Editing, and Media History.” Poe Studies 51 (2019). “From Loose Leaves to Readymades: Manuscript Books in the Age of Emerson and Whitman.” J19 6.2 (2018). “The Journal Box: Thoreau, Archival Media, and the Limits of Nature Writing.” ESQ 63.3 (2017). “Whitman and Mathematics: An Introduction.

item.title: Conference Presentations
item.description: Conference Presentations “Graphite’s Dirty Truth: The Pencil in Whitman’s New York Poetry.” International Whitman Week 2019, Walt Whitman & New York Symposium, The Grolier Club, June 1, 2019. “Graphite Time: The Pencil’s Pasts, Presents, and Futures.” The Futures of Handwriting, University of Louisville, KY, April 12, 2019. “Pencils, Notebooks, and the Streets: American Romantic Scenes of Writing and Their New Media Configurations.” SAMLA 89, Atlanta, GA, 2017. “Whitman’s Two Rivulets: Reconstructing a Reconstruction Text.
